title: Impact of Nutrient Intake on Body Composition in Very Low Birth Weight Infants Following Early Progressive Enteral Feeding
content: Preterm infants have increased body adiposity at term equivalent age and risk for adverse metabolic outcomes. The aim of the study was to define how nutrient intake may impact body composition (BC) of very low birth weight infants fed with early progressive enteral feeding and standard fortification.
